links.quantification: Outcome incentives → cities prioritize AQ action → ₹4400 Cr NCAP funds unlocked via 30% PM2.5 reduction → municipal accountability shifts from activity-based to results-based
Performance pressure → cities deploy EVs/transit faster → 40% vehicle emissions cut needed for PM2.5 targets → 500K EVs deployed ahead of schedule in 102 cities
Target pressure → cities demand industrial compliance → 30% coal plant load reduction in non-attainment cities → 15 GW capacity shifted to cleaner fuels
Fund access → cities enforce CEMS compliance → 60% industrial emissions gap addressed → ₹20K Cr in industrial controls deployed
Measurement gaming: Cities relocate monitors from hotspots → 20% lower readings → false target achievement → fund release without real improvement
Target achievement → health improvements → community demand for sustained action → political support grows → reinforcing accountability cycle
Requires waste fire monitoring: Outcome funding only effective if satellite hotspot data integrated → real-time waste burning tracking prerequisite
Via NO2 reduction: EV deployment → 25% NO2 decline → respiratory hospitalizations -18% → ₹500 Cr/year health savings
Via SO2 reduction: Coal plant controls → PM2.5 precursor cut → chronic disease burden -12% in power corridors
Via efficiency: Industrial CEMS enforcement → process optimization → 10% energy savings → grid demand reduction
